required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Red Cell Distribution Width as a Predictor of Mortality in Acute Methanol Poisoning
clinical_study.official_title: Red Cell Distribution Width as a Predictor of Mortality in Acute Methanol Poisoning

lead_sponsor.agency: Adana Numune Training and Research Hospital

clinical_study.source: Adana Numune Training and Research Hospital

brief_summary.textblock: The study aimed to investigate the association between RDW and in-hospital mortality in methanol poisoning.

detailed_description.textblock: RDW values have been found to be an independent predictor of the prognosis among patients with heart diseases, stroke,community-acquired pneumonia (CAP), pulmonary embolism, chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD), septic shock, and acute pancreatitis.

study_pop.textblock: Patients with acute methanol toxicity who were diagnosed and treated at the Adana City Training and Research Hospital

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
All patients aged ≥18 years who were admitted to emergency departments from January 2019 to January 2020 on account of acute methanol intoxication.
Exclusion Criteria:
Incomplete data, Malignancy, Severe anaemia, History of erythrocyte transfusion last 6 weeks
-

facility.name: Adana City Training and Research Hospital

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: Adana Numune Training and Research Hospital
responsible_party.investigator_title: Adana City Training and Research Hospital

clinical_study.keyword: Alcohol, red blood cell distribution width, methanol poisoning, prognosis
